tweets.text: @CertusCC @EnvAgency @RachSalv @JamesBevanEA The man that stated we don't allow people to discharge sewage into chalkstreams, then back tracked and said in extreme weather circumstances. Hmmm yep he has his finger on the ball.

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

The criticism directed at @EnvAgency after @RachSalv found that it is removing river pollution targets from performance reporting has been huge. You would think @JamesBevanEA would explain his thinking but he never engages so shouldn‚Äôt be surprised at calls for him to resign.

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Poor old @EnvAgency the wheels really are coming off the bus.

2019/20 target for "Kms of rivers enhanced", 2,300. 

Achieved? 1,753. Oops.

Target for 20/21 3,900.

Achieved in Q1? 31. Yes, that's right 31. Double oops.

PS. Can anyone tell me what "Enhanced", actually means? https://t.co/oa1m2WCN5V

We've been planting trees around the Memorial Gardens in #York, to replace four trees we took out in 2019 to create space to build flood defences. For every tree we remove on the #YorkFAS we are planting five new trees. 
https://t.co/fjLkV5dh5t https://t.co/1QCwiAgj9B

tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Have I got this right? 
48 hours ago the @EnvAgency say better regulation is needed to protect the environment, and 24 hrs later they say they will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents of and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/0IefMSag90

Disgusting! As is the @EnvAgency , which might as well pack up and go home.

Total waste time and space! https://t.co/9uRvkpL7EF

@Chilternstreams @CertusCC @EnvAgency @RiverChess @ChilternsAONB @ChilternSociety Well the ea couldn't tell right from left . Their wilfull incompetence over the years means they are not fit to be guardians of our rivers .

The Chess today. According to @EnvAgency 34 days of continuous storm sewage discharge is having a negligible impact on the river!  We beg to differ!! @RiverChess @ChilternsAONB @ChilternSociety https://t.co/Eq1sORKeiE

tweets.text: Thank you @hfrs_control. Equipment from our @EnvAgency grab pack was also used to prevent any contaminated water running in to local water supply. https://t.co/w3ht8rRUeI https://t.co/p4hnGmCJvA

Had a great spring day out on the Mimram selecting trees to drop into the river to aid sediment sorting, fish cover and bed scour. Bees and scarlet elf caps, it's not all trout. @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/DHGpvPNOau
